reviewText: I have enjoyed this series tremendously. It is just a really good series with a whole lot of very good actors in it. It's fun to see some actors who have been in other series in this series. I like the scenery and the houses, too. There are a lot of funny parts as well as poignant parts. I think most PBS fans would like this series very much. It is nice to see a love story between older people for a change. They seem to be so real and genuine in their roles.
couldn't wait for library copy had to buy to get on with the story.  A great series
Love the characters!
We loved these programs. bought them after watching them on tv through our prime membership.
This is one terrific show, it comes in along the same as Doc Martin love both so much entertainment
Best season yet.
None
I enjoyed this program so so much !  It was sweet, funny, heart-warming, surprising at times and even a little sad. I cannot wait until the next season ! Holding my breath.

Well written, well acted, entertaining series. Somewhat bizarre characters but that is to be expected for a UK series. That is what makes it so good!
If you like soap operas this is the series for you. If not, don't bother.

I've watched season 3 at least three times, I can't get enough. The acting is so good by all of the characters. The story seems like it could take place anywhere, anytime, it was just brilliant. I can't seem to get enough of it. I sure hope season 4 will come out soon. The storyline covered all three generations so well. Just a great series.

Love all of the series, looks like this is the last.
This is a very enjoyable and normal depiction of family life. There are always ups and downs. ;)

Love this series!  Lots of twists and unexpected humor from this British show.  Well acted and the story spins in several directions from the main characters.  Light comedy but not any cheap laughs.  Good take in. Can't wait for Season 4!

People have recommended the series to me, but at first, I wasn't that keen to watch it.  Who wants to see a show about geriatric love, I thought.  But boy, am I glad I watched it.  It is a tremendously entertaining show that centers around an elderly couple who reunite via Facebook, decades (or a lifetime) after an almost-romance as teenagers.  But there are so many quirky, intersecting plot lines involving their respective families that make this show so immensely fun to watch.  All the characters - including Alan & Celia, the elderly couple - are flawed in such a human way that draws you into their stories.  The posh & stoic Caroline with her (initially) forbidden romance, the human train wreck Gillian who seems to look for trouble & bad relationships, & John, Caroline's useless & weak-minded ex-husband.  It's a drama about dysfunctional relationships & imperfect people that manages to have a funny, warm & light tone, that makes it prone to binge-watching.

The performances are wonderful.  Derek Jacobi & Anne Reid are pro's, with all the theater & TV experience between them.  Sarah Lancashire is brilliant as Caroline.  Just to see how great she is, watch Happy Valley, a gritty crime drama in which she plays a tough police sergeant.  In fact, Happy Valley was also created by the talented Sally Wainwright, the creator of Last Tango, & the 2 shows couldn't be more different.  What they have in common is that they are both gripping & addictive.

Great, quality show, highly recommended!
One of the best TV series I have seen.
Love this show.
My Husband and I WATCH All of THE SHOWS on PBS - WHYY, BBC and ALL SHOWS BY NETWORK. The British TV Shows, Series and Movies are AWESOME. I'm HOOKED.  Thank You
Superb series with laughter and real life with tears and sorrows
Would not buy again.
Great story, love the characters.

We had to have the final of a great series.
wonderful acting, locations and story.

N.B. the Seasons all tie together and can make one very long and entertaining story. Watched Season 1 and thoroughly enjoyed it. Had to then watch Season 2 and loved that. Season 3 was almost as much fun as the others. This is an English show with its more subtle type humor and situation type comedy. The characters are interesting, almost real type people that you feel for. Probably geared towards a more mature crowd (?). Watch the first episode or two of Season 1. If you like, only watch the balance in season order. Season 3 is not as riveting as the first two, but if you've gotten that far, how could you stop?
All 3 seasons were great, but the first one was the best.
Excellent!
Love it!!!!!
I love this quirky British program.  It's very charming, relevant, and full of twists and turns.  The characters are well developed and so endearing - with a few exceptions.  It's very entertaining!!
An extraordinary ensemble in a touching series.
Just love this series. Such down-to-earth characters and real-life situations made me want to watch almost from beginning to end. Great fun, and I miss the characters already!
We love this series, and cannot wait for the next season!
Great loved it ..there are characters like them in real life families.
Great, entertaining show with a lot of "LIFE" in it, if you know what I mean. Also, very funny.
Every episode had scenes that just froze up.

Surprised that no review has mentioned the "alternate plot" that shows up in Season 3. It makes the trilogy (so far) disjointed. Instead of having the story pick up where it left off in Season 2, Gary shows up, as if for the first time and we begin to go through all that again. I understand flashbacks but this is no flashback. It's a new storyline that conflicts with the original. Also in the opening episode, Katie is alive and pregnant so you either have to deny her tragic death in Season 2 or get ready to experience it once again. I had been excited to start Season 3, but after the first episode, think I'll move on.
A little less credible--and a lot less charming--than the first two seasons, but still a work of fine quality.

Oh my! It's got characters you love and characters you hate. Even the ones you love are only human and show their ugly sides sometimes.
Lots of drama. Fun to watch.
Great... Hope there's a 3rd season!!
Love that series
Excellent
Love, love, love this series!  Touching and humorous
Can't wait until season 4.
Love this show!
Leave it to the BBC to come up with this concept and ensemble cast. Be sure to start with season 1 or none of this will make any sense.
great show, very well written and acted.  can't wait until season 4!!!

This is a terrific show - well written, well acted, funny, poignant, you name it.  Of course, the number of dramatic events that happen in a short period of time is not believable, but it is great entertainment.  British TV at its best.
Excellent writing, characters and developing storyline all rolled into on---you will not be disappointed.
Acting is stunning. Sarah Lancashire is truly wonderful!

I so enjoyed LTIH that I purchased Season 1 and 2. But, I was really disappointed with Season 3. In eliminating, Kate Sally Wainwright substituted one story line (lesbian relationship) for another (single mom) and very quickly since Caroline-Kate's relationship hardly seemed explored. Also, in my opinion, the characters of Gillian and Caroline were recast and less appealing that the two women Wainwright had drawn with courageous, bold strokes.  They seemed weak and silly in Episode 6's finale.  Nonetheless, this does not mean I am not looking forward to Season 4. To paraphrase Gillian, when you love someone, don't you love them warts and all?  Poor Wainwright.  She has spoiled us;  we expect to be 100% delighted from her many gifts every time out.  Bottom line: This is a fine, British series with a superb cast and writer.  Watch it.
I so enjoy this series. The complexity of the characters makes for thoughtful viewing. I wish it was available in the U.S. concurrently with the British broadcast schedule.
What a fascinating show.  Unusual, all-too-human characters, well written - leaving you lots to talk about as the credits roll.  Now I'm longing for Season 4.
Family connections continue to tangle up. As good as the first 2 seasons.
Love this series.  Interesting, well-developed characters with modern, edgy storylines played by veteran actors.  Highly recommended.
great
Great series.
What is not to love about this series?
Good story line.  Good acting.  Well worth watching.
I liked it very much, full of Drama and Funny...........
The Brits are the best
Fantastic. sensitive, great acting, great story line. Simply wonderful.

This is still one of the best shows on television. You can't get more of a stellar cast. Fantastic acting, storylines keep you engaged, writing is realistic and engaging and location scenery is beautiful.
Very entertaining . . . But not for young children!
Great

No doubt most viewers liked all three seasons. However there were awful plot failures in this season. While there are stellar actors, almost none were given a story line that complemented their skills. Alan's illegitimate son, Kate's death (while fully pregnant, on the day after her wedding) was just plain cruel and added nothing to the integrity of LTiH. Celia regresses to racist and homophobic comments, Caroline falls in manure and can't even find a tablecloth to cover her outfit while Robbie vomits while saying his vows. Please! I join the small but accurate minority in saying this series was a loss.
Last Tango in Halifax Seasons 1 2 3 have become one of my favorite series! Love all the actors! Sarah Lancashire is such a wonderful actress!

This is a old fashioned "soap opera" set in a beautiful place, with great actors and production values. I did watch  American soaps in the 70-80s, so I don't mean anything bad by "soap opera". "Action packed" might be an appropriate description too. The characters Alan and Celia are never forgotten while the other generations get screen time, all the families mix together.  Perhaps their mixing together so much is why I used the term soap opera!
Great characters and theme.  Wonderful and rare plot lines that are driven by emotions, choices, character needs and actions.  All too rare.  Watch and watch again.
I don't know how we got so hooked on this series. But we had to see what happened in season three.

I am a faithful fan of Last Tango. It is so well written and acted. I watched Episode 2 last night and was saddened by the story turn. Then, I had a sad dream about the characters. Now, I call that taking it to heart!
Great, heartwarming, funny!

Superb acting, of course. Clever what's-coming-next plotting. Deft directing and editing. And, as always, fine costuming and set design. Yet another reason that British, Canadian, Australian and New Zealand productions are tiers above tired U.S. formulaic dumbing down productions.
Great show and would highly recommend it.
Well done!
Been a fan since season 1 and season 2 was even better. But they lost me with season 3 all esp.
Bought this for the wife, and she was excited. She is watching it front to back without stopping.
Loved it...hoping for Season 4 soon

charming!

Seasons 1 and 2 were wonderful, but I wouldn't waste my money on this one. The storyline devolved into typical soap opera fare right off the bat with the long lost son and the tragic accident. The plot is  trite and unbelievable. The acting is stellar however, especially Sarah Lancashire. She does her best but even she can't save this drivel. If I were you I'd stop at Season 2.

I love this series. Terrific acting and engaging characters. Each of the characters have their turn showing their flaws and their strengths; the story line is rich and complex. Gorgeous camera work. I can't give this series enough stars, really.
Very funny. Touching. Anxiety producing. Excellent acting!

Normally I don't care a great deal for the so-called soap opera type of dramas that appear frequently on the large or small screen finding them too heavy-laden with clichs, stereo-typical characters being, to me, poorly acted, etc.  The wonderful British series Last Tango in Halifax, for me, is the exception to my dislike of the genre.  Now in its third (3rd) season, Last Tango is adored by me.

Season three (3) is acted and directed so very good! Derek Jacoby is fantastic as husband/ father/stepdad having recently married his sweetheart from his youth acquiring step children plus, being a widower, bring to the mix.a daughter  that requires much high maintenance plus having an unknown adult sonportrayed marvelously by one of my favorite actors, Rubert Graves,  Jacobys new wife is acted wonderfully by Anne Reidshe too adds to the great mix and/or brew--children with issues such as lesbianism, nasty divorces, rebellious kids, etc. What a wonderful cauldron of family happenings--I am always intrigued.  This somewhat frightening mix is extremely very evident in Series three (3).  However, the story lines are all believable ( often very funny) and so well acted by ALL.

As I stated before, Season three (3) is so very good with all of the actors in top form and I  really look forward to more series of Last Tango in Halifax".
love it can't wait for nexr season
This series is delightful.  The characters feel like family.  Great acting.
these people so likeable
As advertised, fast shipping
Brilliant show! Well cast, well written.  Complexed story. Very true to life.
Keep it coming.

This is a charming British series about a couple, Celia and Alan, reunited after 50 years and their families.  The acting is superb and the story line takes many twists and turns following the family clan filled with drama and delightful comedic touches.

The plot has its soap opera style twists and turns but that's where the similarity ends!  The dialogue is brilliantly written, the acting is superb, and the visuals are stunning.  Funny, sad, moving, full of tension and multi-dimensional characters, I cannot wait for the next (and final?) season!  Don't miss this one.

Watch and listen carefully or you might miss something. The story is about families and friends and their dysfunctional and loving relationships. Love/hate relationships abound with much forgiveness and outrageous behavior.
Love this British series.  Actors all do a great job.
Very touching, funny and well done.
Enjoyable!
Great English sit com.  Keeps me awake watching it.  My wife says that is something!
Love this series!  Characters developed very well!  Lots of interesting topics in this series!
Very interesting - I like the writing.
Very much enjoy this quirky cast of characters and their incredibly complex and interwoven lives and problems!
What a great show! The actors are amazing and I love the storyline.  Celia is the best, she plays her roles so well and i just love all the characters.
Great show!
One of the best series ever. Great actors and constant drama. Loved watching every minute of it!! When is season 4 coming on???
Love this story

Crazy families intertwined through two old flames that get back together late in life.  You will experience every emotion while watching this roller coaster series.  Never a dull moment.

I love this show and am sad that I've binge-watched all the episodes and have to wait for the new season to start.  I love the cast.  They are so genuinely human.  I would love to hang out with them.  I think Gillian is my favorite, she never sees beyond the end of her nose and steps into one mess after another.  She is genuinely remorseful every time.  Holier-than- thou Caroline was priceless, changing a tire in her wedding togs, covered in horse manure.  The story line of Alan and Celia is such a real-life fairy tale.
Just love this funny & charming show! So glad I discovered it, now I can't get enough of it! Hope it continues to be made for a long time!

Boycotting Wainright unless she apologizes publicly and corrects the story line. The story did not need Mom to skip the wedding and absolutely didn't need to kill Kate because the writer screwed up by having Celia skip Caroline's wedding. Make it all a bad dream and redo everything or don't bother posting another season as far as I'm concerned.
This is an excellent show. So glad that you carry this

Wonderful series! Considering I'm over 50, I often find myself wishing that there were more fictional characters on film over the age of 30. Not only is this story centered around an older retired couple, but it also features a forty-something lesbian couple. Excellent writing with a plot that never seems to disappoint. Dysfunctional family dynamics with every plot twist. My only disappointment was with the killing of one of my favorite characters.
It just gets better and better!!
Love Love this show hope they have season 4

a letdown from previous seasons-- contrived plot situations, with some truly inexplicable character reversals.  Sentiment descended into sentimentality.  Gillian remains the most interesting character but the plots keep spinning a variation on her shag of the day, without providing a real rationale for her amours.
Love it!

Haven't watched Season 3 yet.  This series is just so much fun!  Since my husband and I are close to the age of the couple in this BBC show, we can relate!  The characters are so real.  I first saw Season 1 on our local PBS station but it took forever for them to show Season 2.  Was so happy to find this on Amazon!
Excellent
Fabulous cast, much better than Season 2.

Sublime. Can't praise the acting highly enough. Sally Wainwright goes too far with her plotting / script, and then a smidgin further. Utterly delightful, laugh out loud funny, quirky and refreshingly blunt. Love it.
Such a fun series to watch! You never know what could happen next.
The actors in this production are so authentic and believable.  It is a terrific series.  The scenery is wonderful and the story line is great.  I hope it never ends.

I liked it, but I'm not sure why.  Maybe I strongly identify with highly disfunctional families -- and this one has got a corner on the market.  After the first generation, the two who married late in life -- each one after seems to work harder to create chaos and misery in each of their lives.  I found myself screaming "No, not THAT one!" as each brought upon himself more misery with bad relationships.  Ah, well.

And the drama continues!!! Wow, in some ways this reminds me a bit of one of our family members!!!! Sometimes a little too much drama and bedding every Tom, Dick and Harry!!! LOL!!! But I'll stay with it for the next series!!!
Love it
Great show!.  BBC version has scenes cut from the PBS showing. This series is superb!

This is a wonderful family saga with brilliant acting by absolutely everyone. It has love, tragedy, prejudice, law, and family ties that unravel and prove stronger than arguments. I cannot wait until the final series.
Great show!
first 2 seasons were marvelous...now they are just scrambling for topics.  every character is suddenly becoming aggressive and angry.
Very satisfied with Last Tango in Halifax Season 3. Great show all 3 Seasons. Watch it over and over again.
funny, complex characters
Love this series
Fabulous series. Just the thing -- something original, interesting, well-written and well-cast. So enjoyable.
Love this show, just the right amount of humour amongst the drama.
It's great

well written and well acted.  After all, it is British.
Binge-worthy!

Disappointed in writer's taking the easy way out by killing off Kate,one day after wedding.  It would have served people better to have Cecilia deal with her homophobic prejudice and to have Kate and Caroline deal with a baby and a new marriage.
Keeps getting better!

I'm giving  "Last Tango..." 5 stars because it's one of the most fabulous, creative, entertaining, charming, surprising, relevant and irreverent shows to come out of PBS.  Not only that, the writing, acting, pacing -- every production aspect  -- is just superb!  ALL THAT SAID, I ordered Season 3 Episode 3 because I somehow missed it and couldn't find it anywhere.  I was DYING to see it, as it was a pivotal episode, having several momentous twists and turns.  HOWEVER:  my stupid computer wouldn't play it!  Something about  not having "Silver-light," or something, and then when I tried to download it, I couldn't.  I am the opposite of tecchie.  Finally gave up.  (SOB!)  Still trying to figure out how to get this Silverlight thing so I can watch it.
I like this show. The acting is excellent and the storyline is fast paced, funny, sad, interesting, and modern.

I hope they have a few more seasons.  This show just keeps getting better and better.  I really am hooked on these people and can't wait to see what will happen in any future seasons.  There are many stories lines the writers can build on.

I love this show!  The premise is sweet, but that is not the whole show at all.  Gillian is my favorite train wreck and I empathize with her.  John, not so much, but I can still see his good qualities.  I'm looking forward to S4 :)
Probably only show that focuses on the trials and tribulations of the older generation. Very well done all around. Good acting, casting script and direction. Try captioning if the accent bothers you.
Great series  Funny and sad all in one!  A bit over the top sometimes, but very entertaining.
I love Brit shows & this one is a sleeper!  The best EVER!!!!!! Ann
I hope this series will be able to continue for many more seasons.
This type of show makes me realize how absolutely awful Anerican network stuff really is! Wonderful!
This is an great series. I ordered all three episodes and we've watched each one twice already.
great series that you want to go on forever, but at the same time you want to tell each player to stop being sooooo bad
Loved this series with its generation-spanning story line.

I love this show! The characters are so believable, and so lovable. At first, you think they could be the people next door- nice, plain folks. But then, they keep finding more skeletons in their tidy closets, and their simple lives become more and more complicated. I think this is one of the best series on TV. Superb acting, rich plot, clever dialogue. It's wonderful theater. I just hope there will be more!
It's not bad. These people are tiresome with all their idiotic problems.  The fault is the scripts, not the acting.
This series is addicting . I am saving the last episode because it will be a while until season 4. So much drama. Lovable and loathsome characters.
very well done
Fabulous acting and storyline.  Loved it!
It is an awesome show. More to it that you think there would be. From start to finish, you shouldn't miss it.
doesn't have the sweetness of season 1 and 2,  still enjoyed the story line of these 2 families
Love this series!
adore it
Can't wait for season 3
I love this show and can't wait for the next season!

Written and produced by women, the script shows unusual sensitivity to a variety of issues. The acting is absolutely SUPERB throughout, 100% of the time. Strong women characters, strong older characters and strong youth characters. I find myself loving the characters, even those the most flawed.

I Absolutely love this show!  The writing and acting is the best. I especially love Sarah Lancashiresq performance. The older actors characters are written as fully dimensional people which is rarely if over seen on the screen. I hope this show has any seasons.
Great cast.  Love this show.
Loved it!!!
Great British show.
Love it, so entertaining!
Delightful show.  Very funny dialogue and story line, but at the same time covers relevant topics in a meaningful way.  Thoroughly enjoyed Last Tango.
Quirky flawed characters with enough redeeming qualities that you still gotta love them

The series is brilliant.  The intertwining stories are made especially compelling by the great acting.  Character development keeps the audience fully engaged in the various twists and turns of the plot (s).
great show!  Actors are all amazing!
A great feel good series. It takes you through a family's ups and downs but in the end there is love between them all.

As usual, the acting is wonderful!  And the cinematography!  The story lines sometimes are overly dramatic, especially later in the season.  Season 3 Episode 1, however, is my favorite.  Derek Jacoby beautifully plays a situation which is very realistic: how many men have learned only much later that they fathered a child?
Sooo good
Great acting, writing, direction.  Can't wait for the next season!
Loved having the Halifax group back.
Very short season with little story line of importance.
Utterly charming.

The entire series (1, 2 and 3) is one of the most entertaining I've watched.  To me it fills us with most every family emotion and more so.  We are faced with the current, changing family and gender rolls, finding it okay.
Love, love, love it!  Fabulous acting, great story line.
can't wait for seaton 4

I love this show!!!!!
Wonderful show. Can't wait til season 4
interesting characters and a non-stop plot line, this is a show not to be missed!

Still intrigued by the relationships in this British TV series--Allen and Celia still shine as the bulwark of their families--and even though some of the interactions appear selfish, in the end--love (in all its glory) wins out!  I hope the BBC continues to fund future seasons.
Love this series.  Wonderful writing, realistic characters, great cast.  You feel as if the characters are real people that you might know (and even want to know).
excellent series in every way. the writing is clear, crisp, witty, and full of humanity. the acting is unsurpassed, without exception. the direction and all the production values are superb.

One of my favorite series. Didn't think I would like it at first but it really moves along and stretches the character's reactions to each other. The acting is subperb. Really really liked this one and cannot wait for season 4.
Interesting characters. At times I wish for subtitles!

Love this series!! Want to go back and
watch it again. Wish Season 4 was already out.
Very entertaining ! A smart show

Fun show!
Great series.
I have liked this show from the very beginning, especially Alan.  Love the characters and have cried and laughed right along with them.  Sure hope there is a season 4!!!
Just say yes to season 4.
Terrific entertainment.  Acting is superb.
Love, love, love this program!
Great series
I've rarely laughed more. Each episode gets better and better. All of the acting is superb.'
Engaging storyline with quality characters that portray its mood and theme. Their relationships are developed in a well defined manner.
Excellent series!
Good acting and interesting characters. Does lean towards "soap opera" story lines, but no more dramatic than Downton Abbey.
Wonderful series.  Can't wait for season 4.

This series is wonderful.  It's a joy to watch something so well written and acted.  I was late to discover this gem, so I ordered all three seasons from Amazon on their instant download and binge-watched them on my iPad.  What fun!
Best series I have seen in a long time.  The writing is fantastic and the actors are so very good.  I am really hoping there can be a series 4.  I miss all of them

I am eagerly awaiting Amazon to offer the next seasons!  Hilarious scenes ... we laugh at least once every five minutes
Great acting, script and beautifully set.
An amazing show. Great writing, great acting. A British "Modern Family", with loads more dysfunction.
Great series!! I hope they have more seasons coming!!
I love PBS and have enjoyed this series, always seems to be a new twist in the story.
Great show. Great acting.
Love, love, love this show! Lovable, real characters that you care about and believe are real.
First class British family drama--make that a comic and dramatic family tale!
Love the series and anxiously awaiting next installment.
Love the characters and this show!
Some excellent storytelling, great acting --- Derek Jacobi was always wonderful ---- but some of the other characters tough to spend time with.
A well-structured, well-paced, melodrama with rich characters. An absolute delight. The plot twists with every scene. One of the finest series I've watched in a long time.
When is the next season? More, please.

This is the best family drama ever!  An absolute delight about people for whom you will come to care deeply.  Such British wit and sensibility, and a charming Northern English way of speaking that will intrigue you.  Love the authenticity of the characters and their flawed, but engaging, personalities.  Every character has so many redeeming qualities, you'll want them to be your best friends.  Caroline is a pistol, and doesn't fall far from the tree, who is her mother.  Alan is so warm and caring that it's easy to fall in love with him.  Jillian is truly unique and a lovable mess.  So grateful to have discovered this series.  Lots of life lessons, as well as superb writing from start to finish.  Rule, Britanica......

'Last Tango' is one of my favorite shows - it takes a stumble at the outset of Season 3 but ultimately wins out thanks again to the writing prowess of series creator and workhorse Sally Wainwright (she's written all 18 episodes to date) and the show's power axis: the dynamic duo of Sarah Lancashire  (Caroline) and Nicola Walker (Gillian). These two are joined through the late-in-life union of their respectively widowed parent (Caroline's Mom + Gillian's Dad).

As first conceived, the show was about those two - Derek Jacobi's Alan and Anne Reid's Celia.  Now though, the series clearly flows through the daughters.  Wainwright''s talent is that she gives her characters big, meaty one-on-ones.  No quick-hit, made-for-TV fluff here.  When Caroline and Gillian talk, it goes on.  And on and on - often seven or eight minutes of riveting conversation.  Both have a lot to deal with in Season 3 - Caroline, alas, has to deal with a tragic loss (frankly, I thought this was a cheap trick by Wainwright -- too soap opera-y and out of character with the tone of the rest of the show). Her acting has been been better.

Gillian, meanwhile, prepares for her wedding with Robbie -- a decision covered in decades of complexity, backstory and emotional entanglement Short story: Robbie is the brother of Gillian's ex, Eddie, now deceased...in Season 3 we get additional layers of information about Eddie's treatment of Gillian and Robbie's implicit knowledge of what was happening.  A lot of this information starts tumbling out as the wedding hurtles near.  How Gillian acts out is  among this season's highlights.
One of my favorite shows ever! Don't miss it. Funny, poignant, real life, and drama.  People who press on no matter what life throws at them.
Loved it.  Can't wait for Season 4

A story where the majority of characters are highly dysfunctional. May mimick life but I don't particularly care to embrace dis function as a virtue. There are some very funny moments and situations but I think the writers are portraying disfunctional as something that should be accepted  and anything otherwise is to be considered politically incorrect. Definitely can tell which political leaning or view the writer is coming from. Celia likes to read the conservative news paper and she gets a few slaps on the hand for that along with a little degrading name calling, like narrow minded and bigot. Not much tolerance there from the Tolerant. Maybe next season Celia can read the liberal newspaper then she can be correct and broad minded and miserable like the rest of them.

  I like to see people overcome personal weaknesses rather than make a virtue out them. Rising above our shortcomings or mistakes and not repeating them over and over gives other people with the same problems hope. It's seems the answer here is just to have another glass of wine. Maybe season 4 will introduce the 12 step program.

Many people really like the show. My favorite character is Gillian because she's very down to earth. She knows she has problems but does not rejoice in them. There's hope for her but I doubt they'll be a turn around for her coming from the writer. I watched the show because I like the quality of BBC and Masterpiece Theater. In that respect the show is very well done. Good acting and likeable characters.

Verified Purchase via preorder
Primary cast members are back and the biggest change is spoiler-exposed on the DVD's cover photo. New additions to the family just add numerous ways for this family to go bonkers, in hilarious ways. This is the ultimate in drama city. Never just one calamity underway, but every member gets frequent opportunity to add to the insanity of relationships tanking. Dysfunctional at its finest. It is the older generation that seems almost sane, but even they have their moments. But love is at the root of all the issues.

Season 3 has 6 new episodes.
SDH Subtitles
Cast is lead by the incredible Derek Jacobi (Cadfael - King's Speech) who is madly in love on the second chance in marriage with Celia (Anne Reid- `Bleak House' `Upstairs Downstairs'). The chemistry is magic and a delight for anyone over 55. The show is not just for the aging, as their children, and grandchildren provide as much of the plots as the older couple. Family viewing, but way, way, way beyond the normal family relationship series.
A bonus to the storyline and acting is the fantastic scenery.

Expect to see Rupert Graves in every episode. Of course, Sarah Lancashire and Nini Sosanya are back as the daughters of the reunited older couple, and parenting as well as biological providers is a question.
We watch past seasons over and over, always catching something new with each viewing.

"Last Tango" is an exceptional series in all respects: writing, acting, casting, sets...everything is "perfection." When I began the first episode of the series, I thought, "Oh, how cute."  Now, at episode 4 of season 3, "cute" only applies to certain characters, and to those, only sometimes.  The plot development has been extraordinary, believable in even its most bizarre twists, and the viewer's investment in the characters is deep.  This is a great show, but have an open mind...or be willing to have it opened.
Excellent acting makes this series more than a simple story of a family being  dragged into 21st century problems. It feels real.

I'm really tee'd off about ordering this season.  It is the current season presently playing on PBS and nowhere does it mention this.  I want my money back!  Or a prorated portion of it!

UPDATE:  I called Amazon directly about this and they did give me a refund.  I offered to pay for the two episodes I watched but they said that wasn't necessary.  I am grateful.
All that being said this is a terrific program.  What is it about these British shows that seem to touch a nerve, or two!  I LOVE Sarah Lancashire and Derek Jacobi.  Everyone else is very good, too.  My only complaint is the lack of development in the relationship between Caroline and Kate.  I think it should have shown better what Caroline's attraction to Kate is. That is back at Season One.

Wonderful seriocomic British series dealing with every family dynamic you might think of.  All the characters are three dimensional, complex, funny and true.  It is gratifying to see sexual desire in folks over 70 treated with respect and honesty.  Once a year my own  US city's monthly magazine ( Columbus, Ohio) highlights dateable singles, men and women, by the decade...sorta.  They start with twenty year olds, then thirty year olds, then forty year olds, then fifty year olds and once ( last year ) a sixty year old and then they stop!  I am glad there are some writers out there who know better.  Also the season has just begun and each show is released 24 hours after it airs.  That means the Sunday show can be seen Monday.  Just move your calender notice over a d a y and you will be good.

I don't know when I've watched a movie/TV program more honestly attuned to the crazy-wonderfulness of families. Questions: how flexible is the human mind in the face of change? How accepting can we be to things that challenge what we are certain are true? Can we crank open our hearts when all we feel is fear?
Really enjoy this show. I'm so glad they made another season.

Excellent show and shocking start to S3! The acting is superb as usual. Oh and heads up, if you buy the Season Pass, you get all 6 episodes for a lower price then if you bought each episode individually. I would also like to point out that Amazon reviews should, ideally, deal with the QUALITY OF THE SHOW and NOT the way Amazon Instant Video delivers its service. Please do not give the show ONE STAR rating unless you absolutely think it's rubbish. Take up any complaints about Amazon with customer service. Thank you.

I am so excited to have  another season with these characters that seem so real. Just to clarify, you pay the full price for the whole season and additional shows are available after they're shown on PBS.  How nice to have an intelligent, sensitive and touching story about senior love, family issues of all sorts and alternative choices.  Another PBS winner.

Do not buy season 3 as a season. I purchased season 3 for 10.99. Turns out there is only one episode available. I got charged 10.99 for what should have only cost me 1.99. In other words I paid for a season and got an episode.
Can't wait for the release of the third season! I watched the first and second seasons non-stop...this is a GREAT series!
Great!
I wish this series could continue beyond season 3.  However, the last season was superb! Very heartwarming portrayals by all cast members.

The characters in this soap opera appear as cardboard cut-outs or caricatures--the vicious, self-absorbed stereotyped homophobe Celia, Kate the long-suffering doormat, and the screwy, impulsive narcissistic bipolar case of arrested development Gillian, who in nearly every scene chooses the most ludicrous course of action. Her redeeming quality is her concern for the baby, Calamity Jane. Derek Jacobi is always stellar in everything. What a bunch of lunatic women in this show. However, I can't stop watching this train wreck
love this show
Excellent show
dysfunctional families exist the world over; BBC does a superb job of portraying such.

Lost touch with this brilliant show for a time, and have watched it on TV, online on PBS, and finally, the last two episodes on Amazon!  Just finished watching the ending episode, and seriously do not want to say good-bye to the characters I have come to love over the last few years! It was beyond wonderful, and the acting, setting, and twists and turns of the various plotlines so beautifully portrayed. It wasn't perfect at times, and perhaps a bit slow once in a while, but life is like that as well...I will really really miss being able to peek into the lives of these lovingly eccentric families and follow their trials, tribulations and celebrations. Find myself wanting to know what happens to the teenage characters in the future because they have grown up as the show developed. Perhaps Barbara Strickland could move the setting to New York and come up with a whole nother story line focused on the baby and grandma, and bring in visitors from Britain once in a while!!!
how can you not like this show!
I love this show.  But know that there is NO Season 4.  Only a Christmas Special.
